programme.title: Wildest Islands
programme.desc: Sri Lanka is an island less than 30,000 square miles in size, but it has enough wildlife to rival a continent.

programme.sub-title: Patagonia: The Ends of the Earth
programme.desc: Patagonia is a place of extremes: ice fields, snow-capped mountains, windswept deserts, and violent oceans.

programme.title: Wildest Latin America
programme.sub-title: Venezuela: The Treasures of El Dorado

programme.title: Wildest Latin America
programme.desc: In central South America is a vast, wild expanse: the world’s largest wetland. But this is no ordinary swamp.

programme.title: The Dark Side of the Ocean
programme.desc: One man plans to do what no man has done before. His aim, to unlock the secrets of the dark ocean.

programme.title: Fish Life
programme.desc: Oceans take up three-quarters of our planet: Its inhabitants need to be mobile to feed and breed.

programme.title: Fish Life
programme.desc: Sand isn't considered teeming with life, but creatures large and small lie hidden from predators and prey.

programme.title: Fish Life
programme.desc: Fish display breathtaking colors, but does beauty have a hidden agenda? Is there such a thing as a color code?

programme.title: Fish Life
programme.desc: Submarine sexuality displays some very strange details. It is a world of astonishing and mysterious diversity.

programme.title: Fish Life
programme.desc: The coral reef is the undersea theater of life: the setting is spectacular, and the actors are fascinating

programme.title: Fish Life
programme.desc: There are real sea monsters. Recognizing and avoiding them is essential for survival in the depths.

programme.title: Wildest Islands
programme.desc: The Zanzibar Archipelago is an exotic island chain off Africa's coast. Bizarre, enormous creatures roam there.

programme.desc: The native inhabitants of the Galapagos islands, finches and more, proved key to Darwin's theory of evolution.

programme.sub-title: Sharks from the Island of Fiji

programme.desc: When Botswana became poacher-free, a mass migration of elephants followed. It now is a haven for elephants.
